text: The copper pheasant (Syrmaticus soemmerringii) is a bird. It is endemic to Japan. The male measures up to long including the tail. The female measures up to . They mainly live in forests and riverbeds in mountainous areas with altitude less than . They are omnivores. They eat plants, leaves, flowers, fruits, seeds, insects, crustaceans etc. They are listed as Near Threatened on the IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Copper pheasants lay 6-12 eggs from April to June. The egg has a major diameter of . It has a minor diameter of . Capturing of Masuyamadori was prohibited until September 14, 2017 (Heisei 29). ==References== Category:Phasianidae Category:Birds of Japan
title: Copper pheasant
